p: (c) Freeze-drying or Lyophilisation: It is widely used at laboratory-scale only to dry microalgae since large scale production can be very expensive [ 20]. Freeze-drying is a direct dehydration process of frozen products using sublimation mechanism. The microalgae are frozen to solidify the material within before freeze-drying. The moisture content of the microalgae is decreased slowly at low-temperature, maintaining the solid structure and the quality of the product [ 27].
